properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 7:37AM CST until January 12 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Chicago IL
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Chicago has issued a Flood Warning
for the following rivers in Illinois...

Thorn Creek at Thornton affecting Cook County

The following forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well
as forecast precipitation 24-48 hours into the future.

The National Weather Service in Chicago has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Thorn Creek at Thornton, or from Near Glenwood downstream to
confluence with Little Calumet River.
* until Sunday evening.
* At  630 AM Saturday the stage was 9.0 feet.
* Flood stage is 10.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by this morning and continue to
rise to near 12.0 feet by this evening. The river will fall below
flood stage by Sunday afternoon.
properties.instruction:
Safety message...If you encounter a flooded roadway...turn around and
find an alternate route.

Additional information can be found at weather.gov/chicago.
